name: Sociology of the Global South
description: This course examines the causes and consequences of empire, imperialism, and colonization to help better understand contemporary inequalities across the globe. The first part of the course focuses on theories of the Global South and the second part of the course applies those theories to the practice of social science research. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, 1.0 SOC credit at the 300 level
